name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TomMcTague: What’s that? For Christmas, all you want is a reflective Atlanticky piece on the meaning of nation in today’s interdependent world? Well, you’re just in luck! Merry Christmas—a piece on Great Yarmouth, fish, Brexit and the lessons of 2016-2020👇🎣🎅🥂 https://t.co/zfMOiWxDPY

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I remember all of the faces of those lost—the thousands of other stories I’ve read and cried over throughout this pandemic. Each one of these people meant the world to someone. Every one of their lives had meaning," @alexjgoldstein writes: https://t.co/TCxqHJOiaa

name: TheAtlantic
text: The director of "Up" and "Inside Out" has made another cerebral adventure with Pixar's "Soul," an ambitious animated tale about the meaning of existence, @davidlsims writes. https://t.co/7mOUlWlsu9

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @NickBaumann: “Emma? This is Santa speaking.” True story I woke up sweating at 4 a.m. and realized I had scheduled this story with a default tweet calling Santa an 'elf' that would inevitably prompt Christmas correction emails.

Good morning! @emmaogreen spoke to Santa: https://t.co/2kC2hzllJT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Emma? This Is Santa Speaking." But even Santa can’t make the coronavirus go away. @emmaogreen talks to the man himself: https://t.co/0p1vqC4hJY
